timings: Temple darshan slots vary by festival/season; exact daily hours Not documented (special darshan windows reported seasonally). Darshan Timing
entry_fee: No general entry fee for darshan; special services/queues may have charges — Not documented
best_time: October – February (cooler weather; major pilgrim season, including Shivratri and Shravan month).
accessibility: Town access by road; inner temple complex can be crowded — wheelchair access limited in older/unmodernised areas; new corridor works have improved access in parts.
guided_tours: Priests and local pilgrimage guides widely available (Hindi/other regional languages; some English guides in peak season).
parking: Public/paid parking around temple approaches — charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Numerous dharamshalas, hotels, restaurants, prasadam shops, medical aid booths during large festivals.
special_notes: One of the 12 Jyotirlingas — extremely busy during Shravan (monsoon months) and on Shivratri; large-scale pilgrim infrastructure upgrades in recent years. babadham.org+1

category: Religious / Hill pilgrimage (Jain Shikharji — holiest Jain tirtha)
timings: Pilgrimage site open year-round; specific shrine/ashram timings vary — Not documented.
entry_fee: No general entry fee; monastery/ashram donations optional — Not documented.
best_time: October – March (pleasant weather for trekking & pilgrimage).
nearest_railway: Parasnath Railway Station (PNME) — station serves the base; approx. distance to key Madhuban climb points: Not documented precisely (reports cite ~20–30 km to some pilgrimage spots)
nearest_bus: Local bus terminus at Isri / Giridih
accessibility: Reaching summit requires trekking over hilly terrain — several well used pilgrimage paths; not wheelchair-friendly. Roads to base are motorable; pilgrims may arrange porter/palki where required.
guided_tours: Local guides and religious groups provide guided pilgrimages in Hindi and regional languages; Jain organisations often organise group yatra packages.
parking: Parking at base towns/temples — charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Ashrams, dharamshalas, small eateries and shops in base towns.
wikipedia: Parasnath Hill pages & Parasnath railway station
special_notes: Considered the holiest Jain tirtha — many small temples/shrines dotted along the hill; multi-day pilgrimage for some devotees. Wikipedia+1

category: Wildlife Sanctuary / National Park / Tiger Reserve / Eco-tourism
timings: Safari windows typically early morning and late afternoon; exact seasonal timings vary — Not documented.
entry_fee: Safari / jeep charges and guide fees apply (forest dept. rates vary; examples reported online but exact current fees Not documented).
best_time: October – March (dry season, best for safaris and wildlife sightings).
nearest_railway: Nearest railheads vary by park gate (local railheads: Medininagar / Latehar / Daltonganj vicinity)
nearest_bus: Local bus stands at Medininagar / Latehar
accessibility: Road access from regional towns; safari tracks require 4x4/jeep; not wheelchair-friendly in wilderness areas.
guided_tours: Forest department guides and private naturalist-led tours available; jeep safaris booked through forest department/tour operators.
parking: Parking at park entry gates and safari booking points.
nearby_amenities: Eco-lodges, government guesthouses, basic eateries in nearby towns (Medininagar / Latehar).
special_notes: One of Jharkhand’s principal tiger & biodiversity reserves (close to Palamu forts); excellent for birding and wildlife photography. Trodly+1

category: Hill Station / Scenic Viewpoints / Waterfalls / Eco-spot
timings: Public places open year-round; specific viewing spots accessible at all times (seasonal weather impacts visibility).
entry_fee: No general fee; some private parks or resorts may charge — Not documented.
best_time: October – February (clear skies, sunrise/sunset viewpoints best; monsoon brings waterfalls but roads can be slippery).
accessibility: Hill roads; many viewpoints require short walks; some roads can be narrow — partial accessibility for mobility-impaired depends on site.
guided_tours: Local guides/trek organisers available seasonally; small guided treks to waterfalls & viewpoints.
parking: Parking available near major viewpoints and resorts; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Guesthouses, resorts, tea stalls, small shops; limited high-end facilities.
special_notes: Famous for spectacular sunrises/sunsets, pine forests, Lower Ghaghri Falls, Magnolia Point and tranquil plateau landscapes. CHANAKYA BNR RANCHI - Jharkhand, India

description: Hundru Falls on Subarnarekha river, near Ranchi (Ranchi district)
timings: Open year-round; best flow after monsoon — specific visiting hours Not documented.
entry_fee: Not documented (local parking/entry charges may apply seasonally)
best_time: July – October (post-monsoon for full falls) and October – February (pleasant weather).
accessibility: Roads to falls are motorable but last approaches may have steps & rocky patches; slippery in monsoon — not fully wheelchair-friendly.
guided_tours: Local guides and day-trip operators in Ranchi offer transfers.
parking: Parking available nearby; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Small eateries/tea stalls, picnic spots; limited permanent facilities.
special_notes: One of Ranchi’s best-known waterfalls; safety advisories sometimes in force after heavy rains. Tripadvisor+1

place_name: Jonha (Lower Ghaghri) Falls & Tagore Hill & Rock Garden
description: Near Ranchi — Jonha / Lower Ghaghri falls; Tagore Hill & Rock Garden area (Ranchi district)
timings: Open year-round; best after monsoon for waterfalls.
best_time: July – October (falls fuller) and October – February (pleasant weather for hill views).
accessibility: Tagore Hill & Rock Garden paved; falls may require steps/rocky descent—partial accessibility.
guided_tours: Local guides and city tour operators.
parking: Parking at Rock Garden / Tagore Hill area; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Cafes in Ranchi, small shops, picnic facilities.
special_notes: Tagore Hill is named after Rabindranath Tagore (he camped here); Rock Garden is a landscaped urban attraction.

category: Scenic Valley / Reservoir / Road trip viewpoint
timings: Public scenic drive — accessible year-round (road conditions vary seasonally).
best_time: October – February (pleasant weather & clear valley views)
accessibility: Winding roads with many viewpoints — accessible by car; some stretches narrow — not wheelchair-specific.
guided_tours: Local tour operators in Ranchi & Ramgarh provide drives & photography tours.
parking: Small parking bays at viewpoints; charges Not documented.
wikipedia: Patratu Valley pages in travel guides
special_notes: Popular for road trips, scenic photography and sunrise/sunset views over engineered dam & valley.

category: Religious (Shakti / Hindu Temple) / Waterfall & Pilgrimage site
description: Rajrappa (confluence of Damodar & Bhairavi rivers), Ramgarh district
timings: Temple open year-round; festival timings peak at Makar Sankranti and Navratri — exact hours Not documented.
entry_fee: No general fee; temple donations customary — Not documented.
accessibility: Temple complex accessible by road; steps near ghats and fall viewpoints — partial accessibility.
guided_tours: Local guides and religious tour packages available; tourist guides during big festivals.
parking: Parking spaces near temple complex; charges Not documented.
special_notes: Famous Chhinnamastika (Chhinnamasta) temple complex and scenic rivers — important Shakti peeth and pilgrimage center. Wikipedia+1

category: National Park / Lake / Picnic spots / Wildlife & Birding
description: Hazaribagh plateau / national park area (Hazaribagh district)
timings: Park & lake open during daylight; exact gates/timings Not documented.
entry_fee: Not documented (park permits & safari costs may apply where available).
accessibility: Road access good from Hazaribagh town; trails within park require walking; not wheelchair-friendly in core forest.
guided_tours: Forest department / local guides for birding & safaris.
parking: Parking at tourist spots and park gates.
nearby_amenities: Hotels, eateries, small resorts in Hazaribagh town.
special_notes: Popular for birdwatching, seasonal blooms and as an escape from heat.

category: Hill range / Wildlife (deer) / Trekking / Scenic drives
description: Dalma range near Jamshedpur city (East Singhbhum district)
timings: Public hill area open year-round; departmental parks follow day timings.
entry_fee: Not documented (some park areas may charge small fees)
accessibility: Hill roads and trekking trails; partial accessibility depending on location.
guided_tours: Local trekking guides / day-trip operators available.
parking: Parking near popular entry points; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Resorts near Dimna/Dalma area, eateries in Jamshedpur.
special_notes: Popular local weekend getaway for city residents; known for deer sightings close to the city.

place_name: Jubilee Park & A J Park (Urban attractions)
category: Urban park / Family recreation / Botanical displays
description: Jubilee Park, Sakchi area, Jamshedpur (East Singhbhum)
timings: Park typically open daytime; exact hours Not documented.
entry_fee: Often free or nominal for certain attractions inside — Not documented.
accessibility: Paved walkways; reasonably accessible for wheelchairs in main park areas.
guided_tours: Not typically required; park staff & signage available.
parking: Parking at park premises / nearby roads.
nearby_amenities: Cafes, boating, children’s play area, hotels.
special_notes: Popular family destination in Jamshedpur created by Tata — well maintained gardens & seasonal flower shows.

description: Sita Falls / Dassam Falls locations near Ranchi (Ranchi district)
timings: Year-round access; best flow during/after monsoon.
best_time: July – October (full flows) and October – February (comfortable climate).
accessibility: Some walking and rocky terrain to viewing points; care advised in monsoon — not wheelchair-friendly.
guided_tours: Local guides and day-trip operators from Ranchi.
parking: Nearby parking at designated viewpoints; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Local tea stalls, picnic vendors, and limited permanent facilities.
special_notes: Popular natural attractions for locals & tourists — recent reports note infrastructure/maintenance issues at some falls, so check local advisories. Tripadvisor+1

category: Historical Forts / Archaeological ruins / Scenic environs
best_time: October – March (pleasant weather for exploring ruins)
accessibility: Uneven terrain, steps and old fort structures — not wheelchair-friendly.

description: Ratu (Ranchi district) — historic Ratu Palace area
nearest_railway: Ranchi Junction / Ratu local rail stops
accessibility: Palace grounds generally approachable by road; internal access may be limited.

description: Maithon Dam (on Barakar River; border area with Jharkhand & West Bengal)
timings: Public access year-round; boating operations seasonal — Not documented.
nearest_airport: Dhanbad / Ranchi / Kolkata depending on route
accessibility: Road accessible; park/shoreline areas paved in parts.
guided_tours: Local boating operators for lake rides.
parking: Parking at dam approaches; charges Not documented.

category: Hill / Cable car zone (where cable car exists) / Scenic & Pilgrimage adjuncts
description: Trikut Hill & Tapovan area, Deoghar district
timings: Cable car and viewpoint hours vary seasonally — Not documented
entry_fee: Cable car / ropeway charges (if running) — Not documented
best_time: October – February (clear hill views & pilgrimage season)
accessibility: Cable car (where operational) improves accessibility; walking routes to hilltop involve steps.
guided_tours: Local guides available; pilgrimage packages often include hill visits.
special_notes: Adjacent to Baidyanath pilgrimage circuits; scenic hill with a cable car (service varies seasonally).

category: Riverside scenic town / Picnic beaches / Colonial-era charm
description: Ghatshila town by Subarnarekha River (East Singhbhum)
accessibility: Town roads accessible; riverbanks/rocky beaches require caution.
parking: Roadside parking in town; charges Not documented.
special_notes: Attractive riverside spots & quiet colonial-era town; popular for day trips from Jamshedpur.

place_name: Ulihatu & Dombari Buru (Birsa Munda related sites)
description: Ulihatu & Dombari Buru (Khunti district) — tribal heritage sites
timings: Open year-round; festival/commemorative events have special timings.
accessibility: Hilly approaches; some walking required to memorials/rocky outcrops.
guided_tours: Local cultural guides and tribal tourism programmes (Hindi & local languages).
parking: Parking available at village approaches; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Local homestays, small shops, cultural interpretation centers.
wikipedia: Birsa Munda pages & local heritage pages
special_notes: Important sites connected to tribal leader Birsa Munda — strong cultural and historical significance for indigenous communities.
